events.message: Customer filed a claim reporting a collision involving their vehicle on the highway during rush hour.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial incident description submitted by the customer.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the auto accident claim and will coordinate further communications.
The insurance company has acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the customer their case is being prioritized.
Request sent to the customer for accident photos, police report, and vehicle damage estimates to proceed with the investigation.
Customer submitted all requested documents including police report and repair shop estimates for the damaged vehicle.
Investigation began to assess the details of the accident, verify the claims, and determine fault and coverage.
Investigation completed successfully confirming coverage eligibility and damage estimate accuracy.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer detailing repair cost coverage and any applicable deductibles.
The customer responded positively to the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the timely handling of the claim.
The claim was officially approved following customer acceptance of the proposed settlement terms.
Insurance payment was processed and issued to cover the repair costs as agreed in the settlement.
Claim was formally closed after payment issuance and confirmation from the customer on repair progress.
The closed claim record was archived for future reference in the company database.
